revised_title: Observations on the Brains of Men and Animals Infected with Trypanosomes: A Study of Sleeping Sickness and Its Effects on the Central Nervous System
tldr: This study examines the brains of men and animals infected with various forms of trypanosomes, focusing on the effects of sleeping sickness on the central nervous system. The author observes chronic meningo-encephalitis and inflammation in all cases of sleeping sickness, with marked degeneration of ganglion cells and glial cell proliferation. The study also discusses the role of trypanosomes in the disease process and the potential involvement of secondary or terminal infections.
